meanings.sent1: The cat decided to begone from the room when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he would begone from the office to enjoy the evening.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was told to begone from the bird feeder, but it kept coming back for more seeds.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows began to begone, leaving the world in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The magician made the rabbit begone from the hat, surprising the audience.

meanings.definition: Used as a command to leave immediately
meanings.sent1: Begone! The children shouted at the pesky flies buzzing around them.
meanings.sent2: When the doorbell rang late at night, the homeowner yelled, 'Begone!'
meanings.sent3: Begone, foul smell! The chef exclaimed as he opened the refrigerator.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered ominously, as if nature itself was commanding the sun to begone.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight raised his sword and shouted, 'Begone, evil spirits!'
